intro: Hormathophylla longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, wiry stems and dense, cushion-like growth form. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. This plant plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
